title: How to Draw a Train

steps.headline: Draw a cylinder for the steam engine.
Draw a trapezoid and a rectangle below it for the drivers cabin.
Draw three rectangles on top of the steam engine.
steps.description: Draw a funnel on top of the leftmost rectangle.

steps.headline: Draw two triangles beside each other below the steam engine for the front of the train.
Draw a rectangle and a square below the steam engine.
Draw ovals of different sizes to make the wheels.
steps.description: Draw the largest ovals in the rear part of the train.

steps.headline: Draw a series of lines in the wheels.
Based on the outlines, draw the main body of the train.
Draw the details of the train and draw horizontal lines below the train to make the railroad.
Erase unnecessary outlines.
Color your train.
Draw two rectangles, one bigger than the other.
Draw lines to connect the edges of both rectangles for the front of the train.
Draw two lines from the large rectangle to the edge of your paper to make your train very long for the body.
Draw a set of lines for the front and side windows of the train.
Draw a set of trapezoids for the wheels and front lights of the train.
Draw a series of lines on top of the train for the antenna.
Draw the train based on the outlines.
Draw the details such as windows, stripes, wheels, and lights.
Erase unnecessary outlines.
Draw lines in front of the train to make the railroad.
Color your train.
Draw a triangle and a rectangle.
steps.description: Draw a border around these shapes to come up with the shape of a bullet train.

steps.headline: Sketch another rectangle adjacent to the shape you made earlier.
steps.description: You can add as many rectangles you want depending on how long you wish the bullet train is. Panget

steps.headline: Draw small rectangles at the bottom of the bullet train.
steps.description: Place these rectangles on the area where you imagine the wheels to be in.

steps.headline: Add small circles for the wheels.
Sketch the train’s doors using upright rectangles and the windows using squares.
Add outlines for the design to help you in adding colour to the train.
steps.description: You can be very creative in the design you choose, this example uses lines for design.

steps.headline: Color the train as desired.
Sketch a rough outline of the train using rectangles and squares.
Add the wheels using circles, make the third wheel bigger than the rest.
Erase the lines in the middle of each circle and add windows using squares.
Add details to the wheels by drawing smaller circles inside each wheel.
Add details on the bumper of the train using basic shapes like triangles and squares.
Sketch the train’s roof.
Add design on the train’s body.
Color the train.

text: Drawing a Classic Locomotive Draw a cylinder for the steam engine.  Draw a trapezoid and a rectangle below it for the drivers cabin.  Draw three rectangles on top of the steam engine. Draw a funnel on top of the leftmost rectangle. Draw two triangles beside each other below the steam engine for the front of the train.  Draw a rectangle and a square below the steam engine.  Draw ovals of different sizes to make the wheels. Draw the largest ovals in the rear part of the train. Draw a series of lines in the wheels.  Based on the outlines, draw the main body of the train.  Draw the details of the train and draw horizontal lines below the train to make the railroad.  Erase unnecessary outlines.  Color your train.  Drawing a Bullet Train Draw two rectangles, one bigger than the other.  Draw lines to connect the edges of both rectangles for the front of the train.  Draw two lines from the large rectangle to the edge of your paper to make your train very long for the body.  Draw a set of lines for the front and side windows of the train.  Draw a set of trapezoids for the wheels and front lights of the train.  Draw a series of lines on top of the train for the antenna.  Draw the train based on the outlines.  Draw the details such as windows, stripes, wheels, and lights.  Erase unnecessary outlines.  Draw lines in front of the train to make the railroad.  Color your train.  Drawing an Alternative Bullet Train Draw a triangle and a rectangle. Draw a border around these shapes to come up with the shape of a bullet train. Sketch another rectangle adjacent to the shape you made earlier. You can add as many rectangles you want depending on how long you wish the bullet train is. Panget Draw small rectangles at the bottom of the bullet train. Place these rectangles on the area where you imagine the wheels to be in. Add small circles for the wheels.  Sketch the train’s doors using upright rectangles and the windows using squares.  Add outlines for the design to help you in adding colour to the train. You can be very creative in the design you choose, this example uses lines for design. Color the train as desired.  Drawing a Classic Cartoon Train Sketch a rough outline of the train using rectangles and squares.  Add the wheels using circles, make the third wheel bigger than the rest.  Erase the lines in the middle of each circle and add windows using squares.  Add details to the wheels by drawing smaller circles inside each wheel.  Add details on the bumper of the train using basic shapes like triangles and squares.  Sketch the train’s roof.  Add design on the train’s body.  Color the train.

Draw the details such as windows, stripes, wheels, and lights.

Draw lines in front of the train to make the railroad.
Color your train.

Draw a border around these shapes to come up with the shape of a bullet train.

Place these rectangles on the area where you imagine the wheels to be in.
Add small circles for the wheels.
Sketch the train’s doors using upright rectangles and the windows using squares.
Add outlines for the design to help you in adding colour to the train.
You can be very creative in the design you choose, this example uses lines for design.
Color the train as desired.

Add the wheels using circles, make the third wheel bigger than the rest.
Erase the lines in the middle of each circle and add windows using squares.
Add details to the wheels by drawing smaller circles inside each wheel.
Add details on the bumper of the train using basic shapes like triangles and squares.
Sketch the train’s roof.
Add design on the train’s body.
Color the train.
tyn_section: Colored pencils, crayons, markers or watercolors
